intro: Tithymalus dimorphocaulon, commonly known as the two-form-stemmed tithymalus, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Tithymalus dimorphocaulon thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to Mediterranean gardens.
